name: Estuary Marches
role_in_state: Buffer and pilotage hub supplying salt, reeds, and navigation services
culture_adjustments: tide-focused rituals replace some inland seasonal festivals
apprenticeship emphasizes hands-on pilot tests over formal guild rites
sea-naming and oral channel lore dominate local toponymy
higher social prestige for pilots, skiff-crews, and augury-teams
kinship-led crews and informal compacts weaken centralized guild control
constraints: ritual-augury depends on scarce imported reagents and trained crews
notes: shifting channels force frequent pilot-chart revisions
saltworks and reed harvesting create tensions with inland estates
primary source of estuary charts and pilots for State_10 fleets
